name: Short title and commencement
description: These rules may be called the Sikkim Government Service Rules 1974. They shall come into force with effect from 15th April, 1974. Except to the extent provided for under rule 4, they supersede corresponding provision contained in the Sikkim State Service Rules, 1940 as amended from time to time.
semantic_text: The Sikkim Government Service Rules, 1974 came into effect on April 15, 1974 and superseded the previous Sikkim State Service Rules, 1940.

name: Application
description: Subject to the note below, these rules shall apply to all Government servants. The pay and allowances and other conditions of service of any person whose service may be obtained on deputation or contract from an organisation outside Sikkim shall be regulated in accordance with the orders of deputation or contract.
semantic_text: These rules apply to all government servants except those on deputation or contract from outside organizations, whose terms are governed by their specific deputation/contract orders.

name: Right to relax, alter, augment or interpret
description: The Government, within their discretion, may relax, alter or add to these rules at any time. In the event of doubt as the interpretation of any of the rules, the decisions of the Government shall be final.
semantic_text: The government has the authority to modify, relax, or interpret these rules, and their decisions on interpretation are final.

name: Regulation of Government servants' claims
description: A Government Servant's claims to pay and allowances shall be governed by the rules or orders in those respect in force at the time when the pay and allowances are earned, that to leave by the rules in force at the time the leave is applied for and granted, and that to pension and gratuity by the rules in force at the time when the Government Servant retired or is discharged.
semantic_text: Government servants' claims for pay, allowances, leave, and pension are governed by the rules in force at the respective times these benefits are earned or applied for.

name: Absentee
description: A Government employee absent from an appointment on which he has a lien, on leave other than casual leave, or on deputation to another appointment, whether permanent or temporary or on special Government duty, or on joining time during transfer to another appointment, or under suspension.
semantic_text: An absentee is a government employee who is away from their substantive post due to various authorized reasons including leave, deputation, transfer, or suspension.

name: Appointing Authority
description: The Government of Sikkim or any subordinate authority empowered to make appointments to service under the Government of Sikkim.
semantic_text: The appointing authority refers to the government or any authorized subordinate body that can make appointments to government service.

name: Compensatory Allowance
description: An allowance granted to meet personal expenditure necessitated by the special features of the place or other circumstances in which duty is performed. This also includes Travelling Allowance, Dearness Allowance, House Rent Allowance and Difficult Area Allowance.
semantic_text: Compensatory allowances cover additional expenses incurred due to special work circumstances and include travel, dearness, house rent, and difficult area allowances.

name: Competent Authority
description: The Government of Sikkim or any subordinate authority to whom powers may be delegated in respect of the relevant duty or responsibility.
semantic_text: Competent authority refers to the government or any delegated subordinate authority with specific powers and responsibilities.

name: Controlling Authority
description: The Government of Sikkim or any subordinate authority to whom powers may be delegated in respect of the relevant duty or responsibility.
semantic_text: Controlling authority is the government or delegated subordinate body with supervisory powers over specific duties and responsibilities.

name: Day
description: A calendar day, beginning and ending at midnight but absence from headquarters, which does not exceed twenty-four (24) hours, shall not be reckoned as more than one day, at whatever hour the absence begins or ends.
semantic_text: A day is defined as a calendar day from midnight to midnight, with absences under 24 hours counted as single day regardless of timing.

name: Family
description: A Government Servant's wife or husband, as the case may be, and legitimate children and stepchildren residing with, and are wholly dependent upon the Government Servant. It also includes his parents, unmarried sisters and minor brothers, if wholly dependent on, and residing with the Government Servant.
semantic_text: Family definition includes spouse, dependent children, parents, unmarried sisters, and minor brothers who reside with and are wholly dependent on the government servant.

name: Head of Department
description: A Secretary to the Government or an officer in executive charge of a department declared as Head of the Department.
semantic_text: Head of Department refers to a Secretary or officer in executive charge of a declared department within the government structure.

name: Head of Office
description: The officer in executive charge of an office of the Government declared as Head of Office.
semantic_text: Head of Office is the officer in executive charge of a declared government office with administrative responsibilities.

name: Joining time
description: The time allowed to a Government Servant to join a new post or to travel to or from a Station to which he is posted.
semantic_text: Joining time refers to the period allowed for government servants to travel and assume duties at a new posting location.

name: Lien
description: The title of a Government Servant to return on the termination of a period of absence to a post, which he holds substantively. Lien represents the right/title of a Government Servant to hold a regular post, either permanent or temporary, either immediately or on termination of periods of absence.
semantic_text: Lien is a government servant's right to return to their substantive post after periods of absence and represents their title to hold a regular government position.

name: Month
description: A calendar month. In calculating period expressed in terms of months and days, complete calendar months irrespective of the number of days in each month should first be calculated and the odd number of days calculated subsequently.
semantic_text: Month refers to calendar month with specific calculation methods for periods expressed in months and days, prioritizing complete months first.

name: Officiating appointment
description: A Government Servant is said to be holding an officiating appointment when he performs the duties of a vacant or newly created temporary post on which no Government Servant holds a lien without completing the minimum number of qualifying years of service.
semantic_text: Officiating appointment occurs when a government servant temporarily performs duties of a vacant post without having completed the qualifying service period for that position.

name: Pay
description: Pay also includes for all purposes any Special Pay or Personal Pay which may be sanctioned to the person concerned.
semantic_text: Pay definition encompasses basic salary along with any special or personal pay that may be authorized for the government servant.

name: Personal Pay
description: The additional pay granted to a Government Servant to save him from a loss of substantive pay in respect of a regular post due to revision of pay or to any reduction of such substantive pay otherwise than as a disciplinary measure; or in exceptional circumstances on other considerations.
semantic_text: Personal pay is additional compensation granted to protect against pay reduction due to administrative changes or in exceptional circumstances, not as disciplinary action.

name: Probationer
description: A Government Servant who is appointed on training to a Gazetted post as a direct recruit on the result of competitive tests conducted on an All Sikkim basis, and whose fitness for the post is under observation for such period as the Government may prescribe.
semantic_text: A probationer is a direct recruit to a gazetted post undergoing training and observation period to assess their suitability for the position.

name: Salary
description: The sum of pay and monthly allowances.
semantic_text: Salary represents the total monthly compensation comprising basic pay plus all monthly allowances.

name: Service on deputation
description: Service in which a Government Servant receives his emoluments with the sanction of the Government from any source other than the consolidated funds of the Government.
semantic_text: Service on deputation occurs when a government servant's compensation comes from external sources rather than government consolidated funds, with proper authorization.

name: Special Pay
description: An additional pay granted to a Government Servant under orders of Competent Authority in consideration of a specific addition to responsibility and for exceptional circumstances to be decided by the Competent Authority.
semantic_text: Special pay is extra compensation granted for additional responsibilities or exceptional circumstances as determined by competent authority.

name: Subsistence Allowance
description: The monthly allowance allowed to a Government Servant placed under suspension under proper order and not entitled to draw duty pay or leave salary.
semantic_text: Subsistence allowance is the monthly payment provided to suspended government servants who cannot draw their regular salary during suspension period.

name: Substantive pay
description: The pay other than Special Pay and Personal Pay to which a Government Servant is entitled to on account of a post to which he has been appointed substantively.
semantic_text: Substantive pay refers to the basic pay excluding special and personal pay that a government servant earns from their substantive appointment.

name: Time scale of pay
description: Pay which, subject to any condition prescribed in these rules, rises by periodical increment from a minimum to maximum.
semantic_text: Time scale of pay represents a structured pay system with periodic increments progressing from minimum to maximum pay levels over time.

name: Average pay
description: The average of the monthly pay (including Personal Pay and Special Pay, if any) earned during the twelve (12) months immediately preceding the month in which the event occurs necessitating the calculation of average pay.
semantic_text: Average pay is calculated as the mean of monthly earnings including all pay components over the 12 months preceding the event requiring such calculation.

name: General condition of service
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: The whole time of a Government Servant is at the disposal of the Government and he may be employed in any manner required by the Competent Authority.
semantic_text: Government servants' entire working time is available to the government and they can be assigned duties as required by competent authorities.

name: Probation and confirmation
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: Unless otherwise directed by the Government in any particular case, the status of a person newly appointed against a post shall be purely temporary till he completes the period of probation, as prescribed for the post, continuously and satisfactorily either in same post or in another equivalent or higher post or posts. On completion of the said period, he/she shall be eligible to be confirmed in his/her turn in the entry grade subject to his/her being found suitable and availability of a regular post.
semantic_text: New appointees start with temporary status during probation period and become eligible for confirmation upon satisfactory completion, subject to suitability and post availability.

name: Acquisition of lien
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: A Government Servant who is confirmed against a post shall acquire a lien on that post while performing the duties of that post or being temporarily away from it on deputation, leave or other circumstances of authorised absence from it, except retirement, or while under suspension. Government Servant shall not be entitled to a lien on more than one post at the same time.
semantic_text: Confirmed government servants acquire lien on their posts, maintaining this right during authorized absences, but cannot hold lien on multiple posts simultaneously.

name: Transfer from one post to another
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: The Competent Authority may, within its discretion, transfer a Government Servant from one post to another. Provided that except on grounds of disciplinary action under the relevant rules, the transfer shall not be to a post carrying less scale of pay than that attached to the post on which the Government Servant holds a lien.
semantic_text: Competent authorities can transfer government servants between posts, with protection against transfers to lower pay scales except for disciplinary reasons.

name: Date of commencement of pay and allowances
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: A Government Servant appointed to a post under the Government shall begin to draw the pay and allowances attached to his tenure in that post with effect from the date on which he assumes the duty of that post. If, however, the charge is assumed in the afternoon of a day, his entitlement to the pay and allowances of that post shall commence only with effect from the following day.
semantic_text: Pay and allowances begin from the date of assuming duty, with afternoon assumption delaying entitlement to the next day.

name: Charge Reports
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: Every Government Servant of Gazetted status shall, on initial assumption of duties of a post, whether on first appointment to Government service or in replacement of another Gazetted Officer, submit a charge report in the prescribed form specifying the date and time (i.e. forenoon or afternoon) of assumption of charge.
semantic_text: Gazetted officers must submit formal charge reports documenting the precise date and time of assuming duties for any post.

name: Subscription to Provident Fund
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: The Government may, by order, require a Government Servant to subscribe to a Provident Fund or any other similar Fund constituted by the Government.
semantic_text: Government can mandate employee contributions to provident funds or similar government-established savings schemes.

name: Resignation
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: A temporary Government Servant shall be entitled to resign from Government service by serving a notice in writing of 30 days. A permanent Government Servant intending to resign from service must submit his request addressed to the Appointing Authority giving three months notice and unless it is accepted, he cannot resign. Save with the previous approval of the Government, no withdrawal of a letter of resignation shall be permitted after the acceptance.
semantic_text: Resignation procedures differ for temporary (30 days notice) and permanent (3 months notice requiring acceptance) employees, with limited withdrawal rights after acceptance.

name: Absence from duty for a period exceeding 3 years
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: No Government Servant shall be granted leave of any kind for a continuous period exceeding three years. A Government Servant remaining absent from the post on which he holds a lien for more than the maximum admissible period shall cease to be in Government employment.
semantic_text: Continuous leave cannot exceed three years, and employees absent beyond maximum permissible period automatically cease government employment.

name: Conduct Rules
chapter: CHAPTER III GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: Every Government Servant is expected to abide by the Sikkim Government Servants' Conduct Rules 1981.
semantic_text: All government servants must comply with the Sikkim Government Servants' Conduct Rules established in 1981.

name: Initial pay fixation
chapter: CHAPTER IV FIXATION OF PAY: GENERAL RULES
description: The initial pay of a Government Servant on first appointment to Government service against a post carrying a time scale of pay shall be fixed at the minimum of that scale. Provided that the Government may, in individual cases, fix the initial pay at a higher stage in the same scale in consideration of the higher educational qualification or past experience.
semantic_text: New appointees typically start at minimum pay scale, but higher starting pay may be granted based on superior qualifications or relevant experience.

name: Pay fixation on transfer to identical scale
chapter: CHAPTER IV FIXATION OF PAY: GENERAL RULES
description: When a Government Servant is appointed to another post carrying an identical scale of pay, his pay in the new post shall be fixed at the stage equal to pay he was drawing in the old post.
semantic_text: Transfers to posts with identical pay scales maintain the employee's current pay level without change.

name: Pay fixation on promotion
chapter: CHAPTER IV FIXATION OF PAY: GENERAL RULES
description: When a Government Servant is promoted to a post carrying duties and responsibilities of greater importance as well as in higher time scale of pay, his initial pay in the higher time scale of pay shall be fixed at the stage next above the pay notionally arrived at by adding one increment in the lowest rate of higher time scale of pay.
semantic_text: Promotions to higher scales result in pay fixation at one increment above the minimum of the new scale, with specific increment timing rules.

name: Pay fixation on reversion
chapter: CHAPTER IV FIXATION OF PAY: GENERAL RULES
description: Where a Government Servant whose pay in a post has been fixed under rule 18 is subsequently reverted to the post which he was holding immediately before such appointment or to a post in the same time scale, his pay shall be fixed at the stage at which he would have drawn pay had be continued in the post.
semantic_text: Employees reverted after promotion have their pay fixed as if they had never been promoted, protecting their notional pay progression.

name: Pay fixation on scale revision
chapter: CHAPTER IV FIXATION OF PAY: GENERAL RULES
description: When the scale of pay of a post is revised, the pay of a Government Servant holding such a post shall be re-fixed in the new scale in the manner prescribed in the order revising the scale.
semantic_text: Pay scales revisions require refixation of existing employees' pay according to the specific methodology outlined in the revision orders.

name: Pay fixation on appointment after temporary post abolition
chapter: CHAPTER IV FIXATION OF PAY: GENERAL RULES
description: When a Government Servant appointed to a post under the Government on a purely temporary basis is subsequently appointed, following the abolition of that post or the return of its previous incumbent, to another post the scale of pay of which is either the same or higher than the scale of pay of the post he was holding, his pay in the new time scale shall be fixed at the stage equivalent to the pay he was actually drawing in the previous post.
semantic_text: Temporary employees moved due to post abolition or incumbent return maintain their current pay level when appointed to same or higher scale posts.

name: Pay fixation on reversion from fixed pay post
chapter: CHAPTER IV FIXATION OF PAY: GENERAL RULES
description: If a Government Servant holding a post on a time scale of pay is temporarily appointed to a higher post carrying a fixed pay and is subsequently reverted to his post in the time scale, his pay on such reversion will only be equal to what it would have been had he continued in the time scale.
semantic_text: Reversion from fixed pay appointments to time scale posts results in pay based on notional continuation in the original scale.

name: Probationary officer training
chapter: CHAPTER V REGULATION OF PAY OF PROBATIONARY OFFICERS AND TRAINEES
description: A Probationary Officer may be required to undergo initial training at any place within or outside Sikkim as the Government may decide. The nature and duration of such training shall be as prescribed by the Government from time to time. After satisfactory completion of such initial training a Probationary Officer shall be placed on probation for a period of one year or more.
semantic_text: Probationary officers undergo prescribed training followed by probation period, with both location and duration determined by government.

name: Status of Probationary Officer
chapter: CHAPTER V REGULATION OF PAY OF PROBATIONARY OFFICERS AND TRAINEES
description: The status of a Probationary Officer shall be that of a purely temporary Government Servant. His appointment may be terminated at any time if in the view of the Government his progress during the period of training or during the period of probation thereafter has been unsatisfactory.
semantic_text: Probationary officers have temporary status and can be terminated for unsatisfactory performance during training or probation periods.

name: Confirmation of Probationary Officer
chapter: CHAPTER V REGULATION OF PAY OF PROBATIONARY OFFICERS AND TRAINEES
description: On satisfactory completion of the period of probation, the Probationary Officer may be appointed on an officiating basis and shall be eligible for confirmation against a permanent post in his turn.
semantic_text: Successful probation leads to officiating appointment and eligibility for permanent confirmation when vacancies arise.

name: Pay during training period
chapter: CHAPTER V REGULATION OF PAY OF PROBATIONARY OFFICERS AND TRAINEES
description: During the period of training, a Probationary Officer shall be entitled to draw pay and allowances as prescribed. When training is within Sikkim, consolidated training allowance for 1st year of training/probationship/Apprenticeship shall be granted at specified rates for different groups.
semantic_text: Probationary officers receive consolidated training allowances during training period, with different rates for within and outside Sikkim training.

name: Pay fixation after probation
chapter: CHAPTER V REGULATION OF PAY OF PROBATIONARY OFFICERS AND TRAINEES
description: On appointment on an officiating or permanent basis after completion of probationary period, the pay of the officer shall be re-fixed in the relevant time scale after allowing him the benefit of increments, if any, which might have become due in that time scale during the period of training and probation.
semantic_text: After probation completion, pay is refixed in the regular scale with credit for increments earned during training and probation periods.

name: Trainees other than Probationary Officers
chapter: CHAPTER V REGULATION OF PAY OF PROBATIONARY OFFICERS AND TRAINEES
description: At any time during service, a Government Servant may be deputed for training either within Sikkim or outside in such course or courses as the Government may decide. During such training, the Government Servant shall continue to draw the salary, which he was receiving in the post from which he was deputed for training.
semantic_text: Regular employees on training continue receiving their current salary, with additional training allowances for outside Sikkim training.

name: Stipend for non-government trainees
chapter: CHAPTER V REGULATION OF PAY OF PROBATIONARY OFFICERS AND TRAINEES
description: A person who is not already in Government service nor is a Probationary Officer as defined in these rules, but is yet selected to undergo training with a view to his subsequent appointment under the Government, may be paid a monthly stipend or scholarship the quantum of which shall be determined by the Government on the merit of each case.
semantic_text: Non-government individuals selected for pre-appointment training may receive stipends or scholarships at government-determined rates.

name: Increment accrual
description: An increment accrues from the day following that on which it is earned. There are two dates for grant of increment namely, 1st January and 1st July of every year instead of existing date of 1st July.
semantic_text: Increments are granted on January 1st and July 1st each year, effective from the day after they are earned.

name: Counting of service for increment
description: All duty in a post on a time scale of pay shall count for increment in that time scale as well as in the time scale of the post in which the Government Servant holds a lien. In the case of permanent Government Servant all leave other than extraordinary leave shall count for increment.
semantic_text: Regular duty and most types of leave count toward increment eligibility, while extraordinary leave does not count for increments.

name: Withholding of increment
description: An increment may be withheld from a Government Servant only as a measure of penalty by an order of the Competent Authority passed under the provisions of the Sikkim Government Servants' Discipline and Appeal Rules. An order withholding an increment shall specify the period for which it is withheld and whether it shall have effect of postponing future increments.
semantic_text: Increments can only be withheld as disciplinary penalty under proper authority, with clear specification of duration and future impact.

name: Efficiency bars
description: Where an efficiency bar is prescribed in a time scale, the increment next above the bar shall not be allowed to a Government Servant without the specific approval of the Competent Authority. Withholding of increment at the state of crossing Efficiency Bar is not a penalty.
semantic_text: Efficiency bars require specific approval for crossing, and such withholding is not considered disciplinary penalty but performance assessment.

name: Reduction to lower stage or grade
description: When, as a result of disciplinary proceedings, it is decided to order the reduction of a Government Servant whether permanent or temporary, to a lower stage in a time scale or to a lower grade, the Competent Authority shall also order how the Government Servant's future increment shall be regulated.
semantic_text: Disciplinary reductions to lower pay stages or grades include specific orders regulating future increment progression.

name: Special pay
description: The grant of Special Pay as defined in rule 5(19), if granted, shall always be regulated in accordance with the orders of the Government and shall cease as soon as there is a change in the relevant factors in consideration of which the Special Pay may have been sanctioned.
semantic_text: Special pay is granted according to government orders and ceases when the circumstances justifying it change.

name: Counting of special pay
description: For the period when Special Pay as sanctioned is drawn, it shall count as pay for all purposes.
semantic_text: Special pay received during authorized periods counts as regular pay for all calculation purposes and benefits.

name: Personal pay
description: No personal Pay shall be granted under the provisions of rule 5(15) except with the specific approval of the Government.
semantic_text: Personal pay requires specific government approval and cannot be granted without proper authorization.

name: Charge allowance
description: A Government Servant who, while performing duties attached to his post, may be required, in addition, to perform the current duties of another post under the Government in the lower class and grade shall not be entitled to any additional remuneration. If, however, placed in charge of current duties of another post carrying a higher or an equivalent time scale, he shall be entitled to a charge allowance at the rate of twenty percent of the minimum of the scale of pay of the higher post.
semantic_text: Additional duties for lower posts receive no extra pay, but charge of higher or equivalent posts earns 20% of the higher post's minimum pay as allowance.

name: Officiating appointment
description: A Government Servant may be appointed to officiate in a post carrying a higher time scale of pay if the vacancy is for a period exceeding one year. A Government Servant so appointed to officiate in a higher post shall be entitled to the minimum of the scale prescribed for the post he is holding.
semantic_text: Officiating appointments to higher posts for vacancies over one year entitle employees to at least the minimum pay of the higher scale.

name: House Rent Allowance
description: All Government Servants including Probationary officers shall be entitled to draw a house rent allowance at the rates prescribed from time to time by the Government from the date of their initial appointment provided that they are not in occupation of any Government accommodation.
semantic_text: House rent allowance is payable to all government servants not occupying government accommodation, at prescribed rates.

name: Non-practising allowance
description: Medical Officers in Government service shall be entitled to draw Non-Practising Allowance at the rates prescribed by the Government from time to time.
semantic_text: Medical officers receive non-practising allowance at government-prescribed rates for restrictions on private practice.

name: Joining time
description: A Government Servant transferred from the post he is holding at one station to a post at another station, in the interest of Government service, may be allowed joining time as follows to enable him to join the new post: 6 days excluding Sunday and other prescribed holidays for preparation; and the period actually necessary to cover the journey from the old to new station.
semantic_text: Transferred employees receive 6 days preparation time plus actual travel time as joining time for relocation between stations.

name: Extension of joining time
description: The competent authority may extend the joining time admissible under these rules in any individual case, if it is satisfied that owing to circumstances beyond his control the Government Servant could not join his new post within the time specified in the transfer order.
semantic_text: Competent authorities can extend joining time when employees face uncontrollable circumstances preventing timely joining at new posts.

name: Status during joining time
description: A Government Servant shall be regarded as on duty during joining time sanctioned under the provisions of rule 42 and 43.
semantic_text: Joining time periods are considered duty time for all service-related purposes and benefits.

name: Pay during joining time
description: During a period of joining time a Government Servant shall be entitled to draw pay at the rate which it was drawn in the old post immediately before his transfer order.
semantic_text: Employees receive pay at their previous post's rate during joining time periods for transfers.

name: Procedure for dismissal, compulsory retirement and suspension
chapter: CHAPTER XI DISMISSAL, COMPULSORY RETIREMENT AND SUSPENSION
description: The procedure prescribed in the Sikkim Government Discipline and Appeal Rules shall be observed before orders are issued for the dismissal, compulsory retirement or suspension of a Government Servant.
semantic_text: Dismissal, compulsory retirement, and suspension must follow prescribed disciplinary and appeal procedures before implementation.

name: When pay ceases
chapter: CHAPTER XI DISMISSAL, COMPULSORY RETIREMENT AND SUSPENSION
description: A Government Servant dismissed or compulsorily retired or placed under suspension shall cease to draw any pay and allowances with effect from the date on which the orders are served on him. Provided that where orders are served only in the afternoon of a particular day, he shall be entitled to pay and allowances for that day also.
semantic_text: Pay and allowances stop from service date of disciplinary orders, with full day pay if served in afternoon.

name: Payment during suspension
chapter: CHAPTER XI DISMISSAL, COMPULSORY RETIREMENT AND SUSPENSION
description: A Government Servant placed under suspension shall be paid a subsistence allowance equivalent to half of the monthly pay he was drawing on the day previous to the date from which the suspension takes effect. The Government may allow him to draw house rent allowance, Dearness Allowance, or Hill Compensatory Allowance also.
semantic_text: Suspended employees receive 50% subsistence allowance initially, potentially increasing to 75% or decreasing to 25% based on suspension duration reasons, plus certain allowances.

name: Reinstatement
chapter: CHAPTER XI DISMISSAL, COMPULSORY RETIREMENT AND SUSPENSION
description: When a Government Servant who has been removed, compulsorily retired or suspended, is reinstated and the Government is satisfied that in the case of suspension, that it was wholly unjustified, order shall be passed at the time of such reinstatement directing that the period of absence from duty shall be treated as duty for all purposes.
semantic_text: Reinstated employees receive full back pay and service credit for unjustified suspension periods, with varying treatment for other cases.

name: Retirement on superannuation
description: The date of retirement on superannuation of any Government Servant in the regular service shall be the afternoon of the last day of the month in which he attains the age of 58 years. The Government retains the right to change the prescribed age of retirement.
semantic_text: Regular government servants retire at age 58 on the last day of the month they turn 58, with government retaining age modification rights.

name: Compulsory retirement
description: Notwithstanding the provision of rule 98, the Government except where rule 101 applies, shall have the exclusive right to retire any Government Servant, who has attained the age of 50 years or has rendered not less than 25 years of service, if it is of the opinion that it is in the public interest so to do, by giving him not less than three months notice in writing or three months' salary in lieu of such notice.
semantic_text: Government can compulsorily retire employees aged 50+ or with 25+ years service for public interest reasons with 3 months notice or pay in lieu.

name: Extension of service
description: In every special case the Government may extend the service of a Government Servant beyond his age of retirement on superannuation as per rule 98. Provided that it is satisfied that such an extension is in the interest of Government service and that the Government Servant is physically and mentally fit for continued service.
semantic_text: Service extensions beyond retirement age are permitted in special cases for government interest with fitness verification, limited to 1-year increments up to 3 years total.

name: Retirement while under suspension
description: A Government Servant placed under suspension shall not be permitted to retire from service until the enquiry into the charge against him is concluded and a final order passed by the Government.
semantic_text: Suspended employees cannot retire until disciplinary enquiries are completed and final orders issued by government.

name: Re-employment after retirement
description: A Government Servant, who is retired according to the provisions of rule 98, may be re-employed by the Government if it is satisfied that such employment is definitely in the interest of the Government and that the Government Servant is physically and mentally fit.
semantic_text: Retired government servants can be re-employed for government interest with fitness verification, subject to pay plus pension not exceeding last drawn salary.

name: PRELIMINARY
description: Contains preliminary rules including short title, commencement, application, right to relax rules, and regulation of government servants' claims.
semantic_text: Chapter I establishes the foundational provisions for the Sikkim Government Service Rules including effective date, scope, and government's rule modification authority.

name: DEFINITIONS
description: Provides definitions for key terms used throughout the Sikkim Government Service Rules including absentee, appointing authority, compensatory allowance, competent authority, and other important terms.
semantic_text: Chapter II defines essential terms and concepts used in the service rules to ensure consistent interpretation and application across all provisions.

name: GENERAL CONDITION OF SERVICE
description: Covers general conditions of service including probation, confirmation, acquisition of lien, transfers, pay commencement, charge reports, provident fund, resignation, absence, and conduct rules.
semantic_text: Chapter III outlines the fundamental conditions governing government service including appointment procedures, transfers, resignation, and behavioral expectations.

name: FIXATION OF PAY: GENERAL RULES
description: Contains rules for fixation of pay including initial pay, pay on transfer, pay on promotion, pay on reversion, and pay on scale revision.
semantic_text: Chapter IV provides comprehensive guidelines for determining government servants' pay in various scenarios including appointments, transfers, promotions, and scale changes.

name: REGULATION OF PAY OF PROBATIONARY OFFICERS AND TRAINEES
description: Governs the pay and conditions of probationary officers and trainees including training requirements, probation periods, and pay fixation.
semantic_text: Chapter V specifically addresses the compensation and service conditions for probationary officers and trainees during their training and probation periods.

name: INCREMENTS
description: Covers rules related to increments including accrual dates, counting of service for increments, withholding of increments, efficiency bars, and reduction in pay.
semantic_text: Chapter VI regulates the increment system for government servants including earning criteria, disciplinary withholding, and performance-based efficiency bars.

name: ADDITIONS TO PAY
description: Deals with various additions to basic pay including special pay, personal pay, charge allowance, officiating appointments, house rent allowance, and non-practising allowance.
semantic_text: Chapter VII governs supplementary payments beyond basic salary including various allowances and additional pay components for special circumstances.

name: JOINING TIME
description: Contains rules regarding joining time for government servants transferred between stations including duration, extension, status, and pay during joining time.
semantic_text: Chapter VIII provides guidelines for joining time allowances when government servants are transferred between different work stations.
