description: Governs procedures and payments related to dismissal, compulsory retirement, and suspension of government servants including subsistence allowance and reinstatement.
semantic_text: Chapter XI establishes procedures for disciplinary actions including suspension, dismissal, and compulsory retirement with provisions for subsistence allowances.

name: RETIREMENT
description: Covers various aspects of retirement including superannuation, compulsory retirement, extension of service, and re-employment after retirement.
semantic_text: Chapter XII regulates retirement procedures including age-based superannuation, compulsory retirement, service extensions, and post-retirement re-employment.

name: Insertion of Preamble
description: Inserted the preamble exercise of powers conferred by the proviso to Article 309 of the Constitution of India for adoption of Sikkim Government Service Rules, 1974.
semantic_text: This notification established the constitutional basis for adopting the Sikkim Government Service Rules under Article 309 of the Indian Constitution.

name: Lien Concept Amendment
reference: Department of Personnel Notification no.29/Gen/DOP dated 10.7.1996
description: Inserted explanation regarding concept of lien as the title of a Government Servant to hold substantively a permanent post undergoing change consequent on simplification of confirmation procedure.
semantic_text: This notification updated the lien concept to reflect simplified confirmation procedures and rights to regular posts.

name: Personal Pay Amendment
description: Substituted provisions regarding personal pay to save government servants from loss of substantive pay in respect of regular posts due to revision of pay.
semantic_text: This notification revised personal pay provisions to protect government servants from pay reductions due to administrative changes.

name: Pay Fixation Amendment
description: Amended rule 18 regarding fixation of pay on promotion to posts carrying duties and responsibilities of greater importance.
semantic_text: This notification updated pay fixation rules for promotions to higher responsibility positions.

name: Training Allowance Revision
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No. 459/Gen/DOP dated 31.10.2011
description: Substituted provisions regarding training allowance for probationary officers during training within and outside Sikkim with revised rates for different groups.
semantic_text: This notification updated training allowance rates for probationary officers based on training location and employee group classification.

name: Retirement Age Amendment
description: Amended rule 98 to change the date of retirement on superannuation to the afternoon of the last day of the month in which the government servant attains the age of 58 years.
semantic_text: This notification reduced the retirement age from 60 to 58 years for government servants in Sikkim.

name: Compulsory Retirement Amendment
description: Substituted rule 99 regarding compulsory retirement of government servants who have attained the age of 50 years or rendered 25 years of service.
semantic_text: This notification updated compulsory retirement provisions allowing government to retire employees aged 50+ or with 25+ years service for public interest.

name: Teachers Retirement Extension
description: Amended rule 98 to provide for extension of retirement age for teachers by 4 years beyond 58 years after performance review.
semantic_text: This notification allowed teachers to continue service up to 62 years after performance review, excluding certain senior positions.

name: Teachers Retirement Clarification
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No.53/GEN/DOP dated 29.11.2014
description: Substituted provisions regarding extension of retirement age for teachers and specified that teachers who attained 58 years shall retire on 31st December, 2014.
semantic_text: This notification clarified retirement provisions for teachers and set specific retirement dates for those who had exceeded retirement age.

name: Teachers Re-employment Provision
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No.02/Gen/DOP dated 07.04.2015
description: Inserted provision that extension of retirement age for teachers shall be by way of re-employment beyond the age of 58 years.
semantic_text: This notification specified that teacher service extensions beyond 58 years would be treated as re-employment rather than continued regular service.

name: Teachers Definition Clarification
description: Inserted explanation defining 'teacher' and excluding Principals of Senior Secondary Schools, Headmasters/Headmistresses of Secondary Schools and faculty members of DIET/SIE.
semantic_text: This notification clarified that certain senior educational positions are not considered 'teachers' for retirement extension purposes.

name: Retirement Date Calculation
description: Inserted explanation that a Government Servant whose date of birth falls on the first day of any month shall have attained the age of fifty-eight years on the afternoon of the last day of the preceding month.
semantic_text: This notification provided specific calculation method for determining retirement dates when birthday falls on the first of the month.

name: Performance Review for Compulsory Retirement
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No.45/Gen/DOP dated 8.8.1996
description: Inserted provisions for performance review of government servants at 50 years of age at various levels for examining fitness to continue in service.
semantic_text: This notification established mandatory performance review procedures for government servants reaching 50 years to assess continued service suitability.

name: Voluntary Retirement Provision
description: Inserted rule 99A allowing government servants to seek voluntary retirement after completing twenty years' qualifying service with three months notice.
semantic_text: This notification introduced voluntary retirement option for government servants with 20 years service, requiring three months notice and appointing authority acceptance.

name: Subsistence Allowance Amendment
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No.69/Gen/DOP dated 27.2.2001
description: Inserted provision allowing variation of subsistence allowance after three months of suspension based on reasons for prolongation of suspension period.
semantic_text: This notification allowed adjustment of subsistence allowance rates after three months suspension based on responsibility for suspension prolongation.

name: House Rent Allowance Revision
description: Substituted rule 40 regarding house rent allowance making it admissible to all employees whether temporary or permanent with effect from 1.6.1977.
semantic_text: This notification extended house rent allowance eligibility to all government employees including temporary staff from June 1977.

name: Pay Fixation for Direct Recruits
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No. 83/GEN/DOP dated 20/12/2019
description: Substituted provision for fixation of pay on appointment to higher post through open competitive examination for government employees on regular establishment.
semantic_text: This notification updated pay fixation rules for regular employees appointed to higher posts through competitive exams, allowing personal pay for differences.

name: Departmental Promotion Committee Constitution
reference: Government of Sikkim's orders pursuant to Notification No.29/Gen/DOP dated 10.7.1996
description: Constituted Departmental Promotion Committee to examine cases pertaining to crossing of probation period vis-a-vis confirmation of service for gazetted and non-gazetted grades.
semantic_text: This order established DPCs with specific membership for reviewing probation completion and confirmation cases for different employee categories.

name: DPC Terms of Reference
reference: Department of Personnel, AR and Training Office Memorandum No. 1779/Gen/DOP dated 17.10.1997
description: Specified terms of reference for Departmental Promotion Committee including requirements for ACRs, police verification reports, and departmental clearance.
semantic_text: This order defined specific documentation requirements for DPC considerations including performance records and verification reports.

name: Transfer/Deputation Approval Levels
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No.94/Gen/DOP dated 31/01/2020
description: Prescribed levels and procedures for disposal of files relating to transfer/deputation of government employees for different groups.
semantic_text: This order established hierarchical approval requirements for employee transfers and deputations based on employee group classification.

name: Tours/Trainings Approval Authority
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No.97/GEN/DOP dated 31/01/2020
description: Prescribed levels and procedure for disposal of files relating to official tours and trainings of government employees within and outside state/country.
semantic_text: This order defined approval authorities for different types of official travel and training based on destination and employee level.

name: Pay Fixation Option on Promotion
description: Provided option for fixation of pay on promotion before accrual of annual increment in lower pay scale to remove anomaly in pay fixation.
semantic_text: This order gave employees promoted shortly before increment dates the option to choose between immediate or deferred pay fixation.

name: Advancement Grade Pay Fixation
reference: Department of Personnel Office Memorandum No.222/Gen/DOP dated 23.11.2001
description: Clarified applicability of Rule 18(1) for fixation of pay on promotion of government employees who had been granted Advancement Grade and later promoted in same time scale.
semantic_text: This order extended promotion pay fixation rules to employees with advancement grades who assumed greater responsibilities in same pay scale.

name: Lower Scale Pay Fixation
reference: Department of Personnel, AR & Training Office Memorandum No.3778/GEN/DOP dated 06.11.2015
description: Decided fixation of pay of regular state government employees transferred/absorbed/appointed to posts carrying lower pay scales under previous pay structure.
semantic_text: This order established pay protection rules for employees moving to lower scale posts, maintaining pay band while reducing grade pay.

name: Revised Lower Scale Pay Fixation
reference: Department of Personnel O.M. No.5330/GEN/DOP dated 11/02/2019
description: Partially amended previous order to regulate pay of employees absorbed in posts carrying lower pay scales under new pay structure with Pay Matrix.
semantic_text: This order updated lower scale pay fixation rules for the new pay matrix system, allowing personal pay for pay protection.

name: House Rent Allowance System
description: Approved system of grant of house rent allowance including provisions for husband-wife both in government service, quarter allotment, and promotion cases.
semantic_text: This order established HRA rules including dual-earner family provisions, quarter entitlement, and automatic HRA rate changes on promotion.

name: Work-Charged Personnel HRA
description: Sanctioned grant of house rent allowance to work-charged personnel in categories of permanent and semi-permanent in regular time scale of pay.
semantic_text: This order extended HRA eligibility to work-charged personnel with permanent or semi-permanent status in regular pay scales.

name: Non-Gazetted HRA Delegation
description: Authorized Secretaries/Heads of Departments to grant house rent allowance to non-gazetted employees working under them if not in occupation of government quarters.
semantic_text: This order delegated HRA approval authority to department heads for non-gazetted staff, streamlining the approval process.

name: Retirement Process Instructions
description: Issued instructions regarding automatic retirement on superannuation and responsibility of administrative departments to ensure retirement on due dates.
semantic_text: This circular clarified that retirement is automatic on due dates and departments must maintain proper records and ensure timely retirement.

name: Pension Case Initiation
description: Issued instructions for initiating pension/gratuity cases well in advance of retirement including maintenance of registers and completion of formalities.
semantic_text: This order mandated early initiation of retirement benefit cases with specific timelines and documentation requirements before retirement dates.

name: Group C & D Retirement Settlement
reference: Department of Personnel Circular No. H(26)5152/Gen/DOP dated 17/01/2011
description: Advised departments to settle retirement cases of Group C and D employees without referring files to DOPART, except cases with anomalies.
semantic_text: This circular delegated retirement case settlement authority to departments for lower-level employees, reducing processing delays.

name: Performance Review at 50 Years
reference: Department of Personnel, Administrative Reforms and Training Circular No. 5151/Gen/DOP dated 24.3.1999
description: Directed constitution of committees for performance review of government servants attaining 50 years of age and prescribed reporting format.
semantic_text: This circular mandated department-level committees to review employee performance at age 50 with standardized reporting procedures.

name: Compulsory Retirement Guidelines
reference: Department of Personnel, AR & Training Office Memorandum No. 555/Gen/DOP dated 26.2.2002
description: Issued guidelines for invoking rule 99(1) for premature retirement including constitution of committees and criteria for recommendation.
semantic_text: This order established detailed procedures and criteria for compulsory retirement decisions to ensure fair and impartial implementation.

name: Restriction on Extension/Re-employment
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No. 113/GEN/DOP dated 11/03/2020
description: Decided to completely stop practice of considering individual/personal request for extension of service/re-employment beyond retirement age from 1st April, 2020.
semantic_text: This notification prohibited individual requests for service extensions or re-employment after retirement to reduce burden on state exchequer.

name: Contributory Pension Re-employment Pay
reference: Department of Personnel O.M. No. 1783/GEN/DOP dated 26/05/2022
description: Regulated pay of employees covered under Contributory Pension Rules, 2006 on re-employment after retirement to draw amount equal to last pay drawn.
semantic_text: This order established pay rules for NPS-covered employees re-employed after retirement, allowing last drawn salary plus allowances.

name: Extension/Re-employment Approval Levels
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No.93/GEN/DOP dated 31/01/2020
description: Prescribed levels and procedure for disposal of files relating to extension of service of government employees for various categories.
semantic_text: This order defined approval authorities for different types of service extensions and temporary appointments based on position level.

name: Retirement Approval Levels
reference: Department of Personnel Notification No.96/GEN/DOP dated 31/01/2020
description: Prescribed levels and procedure for disposal of files relating to retirement of government employees for different groups and types of retirement.
semantic_text: This order established hierarchical approval requirements for various retirement types based on employee group and retirement category.

name: Re-employment Pay Revision Application
reference: Department of Personnel Office Memorandum No. 3905/Gen/DOP dated 18.8.2010
description: Notified applicability of Sikkim Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 2009 to persons re-employed in Government Service after retirement with pay fixation methodology.
semantic_text: This order extended revised pay rules to re-employed pensioners with specific pay fixation and pension deduction procedures.

name: Charge Report Format
reference: Circular No.136/Gen/Est dated 10.5.1984 of Establishment Department
description: Provided prescribed format of charge report for gazetted officers on assumption of charge on first appointment or on appointment on transfer.
semantic_text: This circular standardized charge report documentation for gazetted officers assuming new positions with specific certificate formats.

name: EOL Effect on Increment
reference: Department of Personnel Clarification Circular No. 4297/GEN/DOP dated 29.09.2010
description: Clarified effect of Extraordinary Leave on date of annual increment under Revised Pay Rules, 2009 requiring minimum 6 months service for increment eligibility.
semantic_text: This circular specified that employees with EOL exceeding 6 months in a year require minimum 6 months service to qualify for annual increment.

name: Officiating Promotion Clarification
reference: Department of Personnel Circular No. M(3)Pt.III/4019/Gen/DOP dated 3/9/2010
description: Clarified that promotions can be considered against substantive vacancies only and departments should submit cases of promotions against substantive vacancies.
semantic_text: This circular emphasized that officiating promotions are only for substantive posts vacant over one year and regular promotions require substantive vacancies.

name: Charge Report Format
reference: Prescribed format of charge report under rule 11 of the SGSR, 1974
description: Standard format for certificate of assumption of charge on first appointment and on appointment on transfer for gazetted officers.
semantic_text: This form provides standardized documentation for gazetted officers to formally record assumption of charge with specific information requirements.

name: Subsistence Allowance Certificate
reference: Standard form of certificate to be furnished by suspended official for drawl of subsistence allowance under rule 96(ii)
description: Certificate format requiring suspended government servant to declare not engaged in any other employment, business, profession or vocation.
semantic_text: This certificate form requires suspended employees to declare non-engagement in other employment activities to qualify for subsistence allowance.

name: Performance Review Report Format
reference: Format of Report on review of the performance of Government Servants attaining 50 years of age
description: Standardized format for reporting performance review of government servants at 50 years including name, date of birth, and remarks.
semantic_text: This form standardizes performance assessment reporting for employees reaching 50 years to support compulsory retirement decisions.

name: Month Calculation Example A
reference: Example for calculating 3 months and 20 days on and from the 25th January
description: Demonstrates calculation method for periods expressed in months and days by calculating complete calendar months first then odd days.
semantic_text: This example shows how to calculate time periods by prioritizing complete months before counting remaining days for accurate period determination.

name: Month Calculation Example B
reference: Example showing period commencing on 30th January and ending with 2nd March should be deemed as 1 month and 4 days
description: Illustrates calculation of period between dates falling in different months using complete month and remaining days method.
semantic_text: This example demonstrates period calculation across month boundaries using the complete months plus remaining days methodology.

name: Rule 72 Supersession Note
reference: Editor's note regarding rule 72 being superseded and replaced by rule 20 of the Sikkim Government Service (Leave) Rules, 1982
description: Notes that rule 72 of SGSR, 1974 is superseded and replaced by rule 20 of Sikkim Government Service (Leave) Rules, 1982 with effect from 1st April 1981.
semantic_text: This editorial note clarifies that specific leave provisions were transferred to dedicated leave rules with different numbering.

name: Pay Fixation Rules Update
reference: Editor's note regarding changes in fixation of pay on promotion with effect from 1.1.2006 and 1.1.2016 under Revised Pay Rules
description: Notes that rules regarding fixation of pay on promotion were changed with new provisions in Sikkim Government Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 2009 and 2018.
semantic_text: This note indicates that promotion pay fixation rules were updated through separate revised pay rules with different effective dates.

name: Increment Dates Update
reference: Editor's note regarding changes in annual increment dates from uniform 1st July to 1st January and 1st July from 1st January 2016
description: Notes historical changes in increment dates from individual anniversary dates to uniform July 1st, then to dual dates of January 1st and July 1st.
semantic_text: This note documents the evolution of increment grant dates from individual to uniform and then to dual annual dates system.

name: Pension Rules Reference
reference: Editor's note regarding introduction of Sikkim Service (Pension) Rules, 1980 and need to read retirement instructions with relevant pension provisions
description: Notes that with introduction of dedicated pension rules, retirement benefit instructions need to be read in conjunction with pension rule provisions.
semantic_text: This note indicates that comprehensive retirement benefit procedures are now covered under separate pension regulations.

name: Non-Practising Allowance Rates
reference: Editor's note referring to item 13 of Notification No. 85/Gen/DOP dated 25/08/2018 for rates of Non-Practising Allowance
description: Directs readers to specific notification for current rates of Non-Practising Allowance prescribed for Medical Officers and Veterinary Doctors.
semantic_text: This note provides reference to the current notification containing updated allowance rates for medical professionals.

name: Sonam Lama Case
reference: State of Sikkim and others versus Sonam Lama and others etc. decided on 6th September, 1990 (AIR 1991 SC 534)
description: Supreme Court held that before passing order of compulsory retirement under rule 99(1), principles of natural justice are not required to be followed and provisions of Article 21 need not be observed.
semantic_text: This landmark judgment clarified that compulsory retirement for public interest doesn't require prior hearing or natural justice procedures.

name: Voluntary Retirement
description: At any time after a Government Servant has completed twenty years' qualifying service; he may, by giving notice of not less than three months, in writing, to the appointing authority, retire from service. The notice for voluntary retirement shall require acceptance by the appointing authority.
semantic_text: Voluntary retirement is available after 20 years service with 3 months notice, requiring appointing authority acceptance unless refused before notice period ends.

name: Sikkim Government Servants' Conduct Rules 1981
reference: Referred to in rule 15 of SGSR, 1974
description: Separate set of rules governing behavior, conduct, and ethical standards for government servants in Sikkim.
semantic_text: These rules establish expected conduct standards and behavioral guidelines for all government employees in Sikkim.

name: Sikkim Government Servants' Discipline and Appeal Rules
reference: Referred to in rules 32, 34, 94 of SGSR, 1974
description: Rules governing disciplinary proceedings, penalties, and appeal mechanisms for government servants.
semantic_text: These rules provide comprehensive procedures for disciplinary actions, penalties, and employee appeal rights in disciplinary matters.

name: Sikkim Government Service (Leave) Rules, 1982
reference: Replaced rules 65 to 93 of SGSR, 1974 with effect from 1st April 1981
description: Comprehensive rules governing various types of leave, leave entitlements, and leave procedures for government servants.
semantic_text: These dedicated leave rules cover all aspects of leave administration including eligibility, application, and sanction procedures.

name: Sikkim Travelling Allowance Rules
description: Rules governing travel entitlements, allowances, and procedures for government servants on official travel.
semantic_text: These rules regulate travel-related payments and procedures for government employees on official duty travel.

name: Sikkim Services (Pension) Rules, 1990
reference: Applicable to employees appointed on or before 31/03/2006
description: Rules governing pension, gratuity, and other retirement benefits for government servants under defined benefit pension scheme.
semantic_text: These rules establish pension and retirement benefit provisions for employees covered under the traditional pension system.

name: Sikkim Government Servants' (Contributory Pension) Rules, 2006
reference: Applicable to employees appointed on or after 01/04/2006
description: Rules governing the New Pension System (NPS) for government servants with contributory pension scheme.
semantic_text: These rules establish the contributory pension system for employees joining government service after April 2006.

name: Sikkim Government Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 2009
reference: Implemented recommendations of Fourth Pay Commission of Sikkim with effect from 1st January 2006
description: Rules implementing revised pay structure with running pay bands and grade pay based on Fourth Pay Commission recommendations.
semantic_text: These rules established the previous pay structure with pay bands and grade pay system for Sikkim government employees.

name: Sikkim Government Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 2018
reference: Implemented recommendations of Fifth Pay Commission of Sikkim with effect from 1st January 2016
description: Rules implementing revised pay structure with pay matrix based on Fifth Pay Commission recommendations.
semantic_text: These rules established the current pay matrix system replacing previous pay band and grade pay structure.

name: Constitutional Adoption Preamble
reference: Preamble to Sikkim Government Service Rules, 1974 inserted vide Establishment Department Notification No. 202/Gen/Est dated 17.11.1980
description: In exercise of the powers conferred by the proviso to Article 309 of the Constitution of India, the Governor of Sikkim adopted the Sikkim Government Service Rules, 1974.
semantic_text: This preamble establishes the constitutional authority for the service rules under Article 309 of the Indian Constitution.

name: Repealed Rules 46-64
reference: Rule 46 to 64 are repealed by the Sikkim Travelling Allowance Rules
description: Original rules governing travelling allowances in SGSR, 1974 which were subsequently replaced by dedicated travelling allowance rules.
semantic_text: These original travel allowance provisions were replaced by comprehensive dedicated travelling allowance regulations.

name: Repealed Rules 65-93
reference: Rules 65 to 93 are repealed by the Sikkim Government Service (Leave) Rules, 1982
description: Original leave rules in SGSR, 1974 which were subsequently replaced by comprehensive dedicated leave rules.
semantic_text: These original leave provisions were replaced by comprehensive dedicated leave regulations with updated provisions.

name: Fixation of pay on promotion option
reference: Extract of rule 12 of the Sikkim Government Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 2018
description: On promotion, a government servant has an option to get his pay fixed in the higher level either from the date of his promotion or from the date of his next increment. In case of promotion from one Level to another Level under the revised pay structure, the pay shall be fixed by giving one increment in the Level from which promoted.
semantic_text: Under current pay rules, promoted employees can choose between immediate pay fixation or waiting until their next increment date for better financial benefit.

name: Date of next increment in revised pay structure
reference: Extract of rule 10 of the Sikkim Government Service (Revised Pay) rules, 2018
description: There shall be two dates for grant of increment namely, 1st January and 1st July of every year instead of existing date of 1st July. An employee shall be entitled to only one annual Increment either on 1st January or 1st July depending on the date of his appointment, promotion or grant of financial up-gradation.
semantic_text: Current increment system uses dual annual dates (Jan 1 and Jul 1) based on employee's appointment/promotion timing, ensuring only one increment per year.

name: Increment timing for specific periods
reference: Rule 10(2) of Sikkim Government Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 2018
description: The increment in respect of an employee appointed or promoted or granted financial upgradation during the period between the 2nd day of January and 1st day of July shall be granted on 1st day of January and increment during period between 2nd day of July and 1st day of January shall be granted on 1st day of July.
semantic_text: Specific rules determine which increment date (Jan 1 or Jul 1) applies based on the exact date of appointment, promotion, or financial upgradation.

name: House Rent Allowance for Dual Earner Families
reference: Establishment Department Notification No.67/Est dated 2.8.1974 - Item (1)
description: In the case of husband and wife, both of whom are in Government service occupying a Government quarter, the husband or the wife may continue to draw house rent allowance at the prescribed rate provided that the Government Servant in whose name the quarter has been allotted should not draw house rent allowance.
semantic_text: Dual government employee families in government quarters can have one spouse claim HRA, but not the one in whose name the quarter is allotted.

name: Lower Quarter Occupation HRA
reference: Establishment Department Notification No.67/Est dated 2.8.1974 - Item (2)
description: A Government Servant occupying a Government quarter of lower than his/her entitlement should not draw the difference between the rate of house rent allowance prescribed for his/her grade and the class of quarters he/she is actually occupying.
semantic_text: Employees occupying quarters below their entitlement level cannot claim HRA for the difference between their entitled and actual quarter class.

name: Quarter Transfer Restrictions
reference: Establishment Department Notification No.67/Est dated 2.8.1974 - Item (3)
description: No Government Servant should transfer or sublet the Government quarters allotted to him/her without the prior approval of the Government.
semantic_text: Government quarters cannot be transferred or sublet to others without obtaining prior government approval.

name: Non-Quarter Occupant HRA
reference: Establishment Department Notification No.67/Est dated 2.8.1974 - Item (4)
description: A Government Servant who has neither been allotted nor residing in Government quarters may continue to draw the approved scale of house rent allowance.
semantic_text: Employees not provided with or occupying government quarters are eligible to receive full HRA at prescribed rates.

name: Automatic HRA on Promotion
reference: Establishment Department Notification No.67/Est dated 2.8.1974 - Item (5)
description: A Government Servant on promotion to or on attainment of the higher grade will automatically draw the house rent allowance at the rate prescribed for the grade from the date of promotion to or attainment of higher grade.
semantic_text: HRA rates automatically increase to the higher grade level immediately upon promotion or grade attainment without separate approval.

name: Leave Substitute HRA Ineligibility
reference: Establishment Department Notification No.128/Gen/Est dated 15.7.1977 - Item 3
description: Leave substitutes are not entitled to House Rent Allowance.
semantic_text: Employees appointed as leave substitutes to cover for absent staff are not eligible for house rent allowance benefits.

name: EOL and Increment Eligibility
reference: Department of Personnel Clarification Circular No. 4297/GEN/DOP dated 29.09.2010 - Para 2(i)
description: A Government Servant who has availed of EOL not exceeding six months but has put in minimum of 6 (six) months of qualifying service in a particular grade pay between 1st of July to 30th of June would be eligible to draw his/her increment on the following 1st July.
semantic_text: Employees with up to 6 months EOL in a year remain eligible for annual increment if they complete minimum 6 months actual service.

name: Extended EOL and Increment Deferral
reference: Department of Personnel Clarification Circular No. 4297/GEN/DOP dated 29.09.2010 - Para 2(ii)
description: In case a Government Servant has availed of Extra Ordinary Leave (EOL) between 1st July to 30th June of the year for a period of more than six months, he/she will be entitled to next annual Increment on 1st July of subsequent year.
semantic_text: Employees taking more than 6 months EOL in a year have their increment deferred by one year, requiring additional qualifying service.

name: Charge Assumption Timing
description: If the charge is assumed in the afternoon of a day, his entitlement to the pay and allowances of that post shall commence only with effect from the following day.
semantic_text: Afternoon charge assumption delays pay and allowance entitlement to the next day, while forenoon assumption allows same-day entitlement.

name: Duty Pay Entitlement
description: A Government Servant shall be entitled to draw duty pay and allowances attached to his tenure in a post only during such periods as he actually performs the duties attached to that post.
semantic_text: Pay and allowances are only payable for periods when employees actually perform the duties of their assigned posts.

name: Absence Prior Notice
description: Government servant concerned should be given prior notice before taking any action against him under sub-rule (2) regarding cessation of employment due to prolonged absence.
semantic_text: Employees must receive advance notice before termination actions can be taken for prolonged unauthorized absence from duty.

name: Efficiency Bar Review
description: Withholding of increment at the state of crossing Efficiency Bar is not a penalty. All such cases should be reviewed after every six months.
semantic_text: Efficiency bar withholding is performance-related, not disciplinary, and requires regular six-monthly reviews for potential clearance.

name: Disciplinary Reduction Compliance
description: In all such cases the procedure prescribed in the Discipline and Appeal Rules shall be complied with.
semantic_text: Pay reductions for disciplinary reasons must follow established disciplinary and appeal procedures to ensure due process.

name: Charge Allowance Minimum Period
description: No charge allowance shall be payable under this rule if the period for which the Government Servant is placed in additional charge is less than thirty days at a time.
semantic_text: Additional charge assignments must last at least 30 continuous days to qualify for charge allowance payment.

name: Vacancy Filling for Extended Charge
description: Where the vacancy is for a period exceeding one year, every effort should be made to fill the vacancy by appointment of a whole time incumbent.
semantic_text: Additional charge arrangements should not continue beyond one year; permanent appointments should be made for longer vacancies.

name: Subsistence Allowance Certification
description: No payment under sub-rule (1) shall be made unless the Government Servant furnishes a certificate that he is not engaged in any other employment, business, profession or vocation.
semantic_text: Suspended employees must formally declare non-engagement in other employment activities to receive subsistence allowance payments.

name: Reinstatement Order Requirements
description: When a Government Servant who has been removed, compulsorily retired or suspended, is reinstated and the Government is satisfied that in the case of suspension, that it was wholly unjustified, order shall be passed at the time of such reinstatement directing that the period of absence from duty shall be treated as duty for all purposes.
semantic_text: Employees reinstated after unjustified suspension receive full back pay and service credit for the suspension period through specific orders.

name: Alternative Reinstatement Treatment
description: In cases other than those not covered by sub-rule (1), the Government shall, at the time of reinstatement of the Government Servant, pass orders as to whether the period of absence shall be treated as duty and what proportion of pay and allowances shall be payable.
semantic_text: For reinstatements not involving wholly unjustified suspension, government determines appropriate treatment of absence period and pay proportions.

name: Lien Acquisition Condition
description: A Government Servant who is confirmed against a post shall acquire a lien on that post. Government Servant shall not be entitled to a lien on more than one post at the same time.
semantic_text: Lien rights are acquired upon confirmation and are limited to one post at a time, preventing multiple substantive holdings.

name: Transfer Pay Protection
description: Except on grounds of disciplinary action under the relevant rules, the transfer shall not be to a post carrying less scale of pay than that attached to the post on which the Government Servant holds a lien.
semantic_text: Regular transfers maintain pay scale protection unless conducted as disciplinary action under relevant rules.

name: Authorized Absence Pay
description: The payment of pay and allowance to Government Servant while on authorised absence from duty such as leave or joining time while on transfer from one post to another or during a period of suspension will be governed by the relevant provisions of these rules.
semantic_text: Pay continues during authorized absences like leave and transfers, but follows specific rules different from regular duty pay.

name: Temporary Resignation Notice
description: A temporary Government Servant shall be entitled to resign from Government service by serving a notice in writing of 30 days or of such other period as may have been specified in his appointment order.
semantic_text: Temporary employees can resign with 30 days notice (or specified period), with appointing authority discretion to waive or shorten notice.

name: Permanent Resignation Requirements
description: A permanent Government Servant intending to resign from service must submit his request addressed to the Appointing Authority giving three months notice and unless it is accepted, he cannot resign.
semantic_text: Permanent employees require three months notice and appointing authority acceptance for resignation; without acceptance, resignation is not effective.

name: Resignation Withdrawal Restriction
description: Save with the previous approval of the Government, no withdrawal of a letter of resignation shall be permitted after the acceptance.
semantic_text: Once resignation is accepted, withdrawal requires prior government approval and is generally not permitted.

name: Absence Limitation Exception
description: This rule shall not apply where absence from a post is caused by the Government servant's transfer on deputation or training with the previous approval of the Government.
semantic_text: Three-year absence limit doesn't apply to government-approved deputation or training assignments that take employees away from their posts.

name: Higher Initial Pay Justification
description: The Government may, in individual cases, fix the initial pay at a higher stage in the same scale in consideration of the higher educational qualification or past experience of the person so appointed.
semantic_text: Starting above minimum pay scale requires justification based on superior educational qualifications or relevant past experience.

name: Promotion Increment Timing
description: In case of fixation of pay under rule 18(1) on promotion, increments in the new pay scale shall be granted only after one year from the date of promotion.
semantic_text: After promotion pay fixation, the next increment in the higher scale occurs only after completing one year in the promoted position.

name: Upgraded Post Pay Fixation
description: When a post is upgraded and placed in a higher time scale and the Government Servant, who had been holding the post before its upgradation, if found fit by the Government to continue to hold the post after its upgradation, his pay and date of increment in that scale shall be regulated in accordance with sub-rule (1).
semantic_text: Employees continuing in upgraded posts have pay fixed as if promoted, provided they are found fit for the higher responsibilities.

name: Training Bond Requirement
description: The Government may require any person to whom the provisions of rule 23 to 29 apply, to execute a bond undertaking to serve the Government on completion of the training or probation, for such period as it may determine and also to give such financial or other security for the bonds as it may consider appropriate.
semantic_text: Government can require training participants to sign bonds committing to specified service periods post-training, with financial security if needed.

name: Leave Counting for Increment
description: In the case of permanent Government Servant all leave other than extraordinary leave shall count for increment in the time scale of pay of the post on which he holds a lien.
semantic_text: All leave types except extraordinary leave count toward increment eligibility for permanent employees holding lien on posts.

name: Temporary Employee Leave Counting
description: In the case of temporary Government Servant and in case of officiating appointments, all leave other than extraordinary leave shall count for increments provided that he returns, at the end of leave, to the same post or to another post on the same or higher time scale of pay.
semantic_text: Temporary and officiating employees' leave counts for increments only if they return to same or higher scale posts after leave.

name: Deputation Increment Counting
description: Period of deputation shall count for increment in the time scale of the post on which the Government Servant holds a lien and also in the time scale of the post from which he was deputed provided that he returns to the same post or to a post on the same or a higher time scale.
semantic_text: Deputation periods count for increments in both substantive and deputed posts if employee returns to same or higher scale position.

name: Reinstatement Increment Treatment
description: In the case of a Government Servant who was dismissed, removed or compulsorily retired or suspended from service and subsequently reinstated, the period of absence from duty shall not be counted for increments unless the period has been treated as duty or has been regularised by grant of leave other than extraordinary leave.
semantic_text: Disciplinary absence periods don't count for increments unless specifically treated as duty or covered by regular leave.

name: Joining Time Increment Counting
description: Joining time shall count for increment in the substantive post held by the Government Servant, and in the officiating or temporary post if the transfer is to a post on the same or higher time scale.
semantic_text: Joining time during transfers counts for increments in substantive posts and temporary posts if moving to same or higher scales.

name: Withholding Increment Specification
description: An order withholding an increment shall specify the period for which it is withheld and whether it shall have effect of postponing future increments.
semantic_text: Increment withholding orders must clearly state duration and whether it affects the timing of future increment grants.

name: Special Pay Regulation
description: The grant of Special Pay as defined in rule 5(19), if granted, shall always be regulated in accordance with the orders of the Government and shall cease as soon as there is a change in the relevant factors in consideration of which the Special Pay may have been sanctioned.
semantic_text: Special pay follows government orders and stops when the circumstances justifying it change or no longer exist.

name: Personal Pay Approval
description: No personal Pay shall be granted under the provisions of rule 5(15) except with the specific approval of the Government.
semantic_text: Personal pay requires explicit government approval and cannot be granted through routine administrative channels.

name: Charge Allowance Entitlement
description: If a Government Servant, in addition to his normal duties, is placed in charge of the current duties of another post carrying a higher or an equivalent time scale of pay or a fixed pay which is higher than the maximum of the scale of pay, he shall be entitled to a charge allowance.
semantic_text: Additional charge of higher or equivalent scale posts qualifies for charge allowance, while lower scale additional duties do not.

name: Officiating Appointment Duration
description: A Government Servant may be appointed to officiate in a post carrying a higher time scale of pay if the vacancy is for a period exceeding one year.
semantic_text: Officiating appointments to higher posts are intended for vacancies expected to last more than one year.

name: HRA Non-Quarter Occupation
description: All Government Servants including Probationary officers shall be entitled to draw a house rent allowance at the rates prescribed from time to time by the Government from the date of their initial appointment provided that they are not in occupation of any Government accommodation.
semantic_text: HRA eligibility begins from initial appointment date for all employees not provided with government accommodation.

name: Charge Post HRA Entitlement
description: A Government Servant placed in charge of another post under the provisions of rule 38(1) shall be entitled to claim the rate of house rent allowance prescribed for higher post.
semantic_text: Employees holding additional charge of higher posts can claim HRA at the higher post's rate during charge period.

name: Officiating HRA Entitlement
description: A Government Servant appointed to officiate in a higher post under the provisions of rule 39(1) shall be entitled to claim the rate of house rent allowance prescribed for the higher post.
semantic_text: Officiating appointments to higher posts qualify for HRA at the higher grade rate during officiating period.

name: Promotion HRA Entitlement
description: A Government Servant promoted to a higher grade/post or allowed to attain a higher scale of pay on completion of the qualifying number of years of service as prescribed shall be allowed to draw house rent allowance at the rate prescribed for the higher grade/post or higher scale of pay from the date of promotion or attainment as the case may be.
semantic_text: HRA rates automatically increase to higher grade levels immediately upon promotion or scale attainment.

name: Transfer Joining Time
description: A Government Servant transferred from the post he is holding at one station to a post at another station, in the interest of Government service, may be allowed joining time.
semantic_text: Joining time is provided for inter-station transfers conducted in government service interests, not for personal convenience.

name: Joining Time Extension
description: The competent authority may extend the joining time admissible under these rules in any individual case, if it is satisfied that owing to circumstances beyond his control the Government Servant could not join his new post within the time specified in the transfer order.
semantic_text: Joining time extensions require competent authority approval and justification based on uncontrollable circumstances preventing timely joining.

name: Joining Time Duty Status
description: A Government Servant shall be regarded as on duty during joining time sanctioned under the provisions of rule 42 and 43.
semantic_text: Properly sanctioned joining time is treated as duty period for all service-related purposes and benefits.

name: Joining Time Pay Rate
description: During a period of joining time a Government Servant shall be entitled to draw pay at the rate which it was drawn in the old post immediately before his transfer order.
semantic_text: Joining time pay continues at the rate from the previous post, not the new post's rate being joined.

name: Suspension Pay Cessation
description: A Government Servant dismissed or compulsorily retired or placed under suspension shall cease to draw any pay and allowances with effect from the date on which the orders are served on him.
semantic_text: Pay and allowances stop from the date disciplinary orders are served, not from the date the disciplinary action occurred.

name: Afternoon Order Service Pay
description: Where orders are served only in the afternoon of a particular day, he shall be entitled to pay and allowances for that day also.
semantic_text: Disciplinary orders served in afternoon still allow full day's pay for that day, while morning service stops pay from that day.

name: Subsistence Allowance Variation
description: Where the period of suspension exceeds three months, the authority may vary the amount of subsistence allowance - increase to 75% if suspension prolonged for reasons not attributable to employee, or reduce to 25% if prolonged due to reasons directly attributable to employee.
semantic_text: After three months suspension, subsistence allowance can be adjusted based on responsibility for suspension prolongation.

name: Reinstatement Leave Treatment
description: Whether the period of absence from duty shall be treated as leave of any kind due and admissible to him. When leave is thus granted the amount of subsistence allowance and other allowances already drawn under rule 96 shall be deducted from the leave salary payable.
semantic_text: Absence periods can be regularized as leave, with subsistence allowance received during suspension deducted from leave salary.

name: Extension Service Conditions
description: Provided that - it is satisfied that such an extension is in the interest of Government service and that the Government Servant is physically and mentally fit for continued service; that the period of such extension shall in no case exceed one year at a time, and that the total period of extension shall not, under any circumstances, exceed 3 years.
semantic_text: Service extensions require government interest justification, fitness verification, and are limited to one-year increments up to three years total.

name: Re-employment Pay Limitation
description: Provided that the pay fixed plus the retiring pension shall not, on the day of re-employment, exceed the pay last drawn by the Government Servant before retirement, and also that the pay plus the retiring pension shall not, at any time, exceed the maximum of the pay scale of the post held by him during the period of re-employment.
semantic_text: Re-employed pensioners' total compensation (pay + pension) cannot exceed their last drawn salary or the maximum of their re-employment post's scale.

name: Voluntary Retirement Withdrawal
description: A Government Servant who has elected to retire under the rule and has given the necessary notice to that effect to the appointing authority shall be precluded from withdrawing his notice except with the approval of such authority.
semantic_text: Voluntary retirement notices generally cannot be withdrawn without appointing authority approval before the intended retirement date.

name: Memo 208-258/Gen/Est - Officiating Pay Amendment
description: Substituted rule 39(2) regarding pay entitlement for government servants appointed to officiate in higher posts, specifying minimum of higher scale or pay fixed according to rule 18 based on increment difference.
semantic_text: This amendment clarified officiating pay entitlement based on whether the pay difference exceeds the lowest increment in the higher scale.

name: Memo 405-454/Gen/Est - Subsistence Allowance Amendment
description: Substituted rule 96(i) regarding subsistence allowance for suspended government servants, setting initial rate at half of monthly pay with provisions for certain allowances.
semantic_text: This amendment established the basic subsistence allowance framework for suspended employees at 50% of pay.

name: Memo 317-321/Gen/Est - Allowance Inclusion
description: Deleted word 'and' and inserted provision for Hill Compensatory Allowance in subsistence allowance entitlement for suspended government servants.
semantic_text: This amendment added Hill Compensatory Allowance to the list of allowances that could be paid during suspension periods.

name: Notification 45/Gen/DOP - Rule Renumbering
description: Renumbered sub-rule (2) as sub-rule (1) of rule 99 regarding compulsory retirement provisions.
semantic_text: This amendment restructured rule 99 by renumbering sub-rules to accommodate new performance review provisions.

name: Probation Period Implementation
description: Implementation of probation period for new appointees requiring continuous and satisfactory service before confirmation eligibility.
semantic_text: Probation system ensures new employees demonstrate capability through minimum service period before permanent confirmation.

name: Confirmation Delinking Implementation
description: Implementation of confirmation delinked from permanent vacancy availability, allowing confirmation based on satisfactory probation completion.
semantic_text: Confirmation now depends on probation completion rather than permanent post availability, streamlining the confirmation process.

name: Single Confirmation Implementation
description: Implementation of single confirmation policy in entry grade only, preventing multiple confirmations during service career.
semantic_text: Employees are confirmed only once in their career - in their initial entry grade - simplifying confirmation procedures.

name: Temporary Capacity Service Counting
description: Implementation of service counting for permanent employees appointed in temporary capacity, ensuring continuous qualifying service.
semantic_text: Permanent employees serving in temporary positions continue to accrue qualifying service for all purposes.

name: Initial Recruitment Confirmation
description: Implementation of confirmation process for initial recruits requiring satisfactory probation completion and DPC clearance.
semantic_text: Direct recruits become eligible for confirmation after probation completion and Departmental Promotion Committee approval.

name: Promotion Confirmation Benefits
description: Implementation of benefits for officers promoted on regular basis where recruitment rules don't prescribe probation.
semantic_text: Employees promoted without probation requirements receive all confirmation benefits immediately upon regular promotion.

name: Probation Completion Declaration
description: Implementation of probation completion declaration process by appointing authority for promoted officers.
semantic_text: Appointing authorities formally declare probation completion after assessing work and conduct during probation period.

name: Probation Reversion Implementation
description: Implementation of reversion or probation extension for officers with unsatisfactory performance during probation.
semantic_text: Unsatisfactory probation performance can lead to reversion to previous post or probation period extension.

name: Lien Acquisition Implementation
description: Implementation of lien acquisition process upon confirmation, establishing right to return to substantive post.
semantic_text: Confirmed employees acquire lien rights to their posts, protected during authorized absences and transfers.

name: Single Lien Restriction
description: Implementation of restriction preventing government servants from holding lien on more than one post simultaneously.
semantic_text: Employees can only hold substantive rights to one post at a time, preventing multiple lien holdings.

name: Transfer Implementation Framework

semantic_text: Transfer system allows competent authority discretion while protecting employees from arbitrary pay reductions.

name: Pay Commencement Implementation

semantic_text: Pay entitlement begins from actual duty assumption, with specific rules for afternoon charge assumptions.

name: Charge Report Implementation

name: Provident Fund Implementation

name: Resignation Procedure Implementation

name: Absence Limitation Implementation

name: Conduct Rules Implementation

semantic_text: All employees must adhere to established conduct standards and behavioral guidelines.

name: Initial Pay Fixation Implementation

semantic_text: New appointees typically start at scale minimum, with higher starting pay for superior qualifications/experience.

name: Identical Scale Transfer Implementation
description: Implementation of pay maintenance for transfers between posts with identical pay scales.
semantic_text: Transfers between same-scale posts preserve current pay level without change or refixation.

name: Promotion Pay Fixation Implementation

semantic_text: Promotion pay is fixed at one increment above higher scale minimum, with next increment after one year.

name: Reversion Pay Protection Implementation
description: Implementation of pay protection for employees reverted after promotion, maintaining notional pay progression.
semantic_text: Reverted employees have pay fixed as if they never left their original post, protecting their pay progression.

name: Scale Revision Pay Implementation
description: Implementation of pay refixation process when pay scales are revised for existing posts.
semantic_text: Pay scale revisions trigger refixation of existing employees' pay according to prescribed revision methodology.

name: Temporary Post Pay Implementation
description: Implementation of pay protection for temporary employees moved due to post abolition or incumbent return.
semantic_text: Temporary employees maintain current pay when moved to same or higher scale posts after temporary assignment ends.

name: Fixed Pay Reversion Implementation
description: Implementation of notional pay calculation for employees reverted from fixed pay appointments.
semantic_text: Reversion from fixed pay posts results in pay based on notional continuation in original time scale.

name: Probationary Officer Training Implementation

semantic_text: Probationary officers undergo prescribed training followed by probation period before confirmation eligibility.

name: Probationary Status Implementation

name: Probation Completion Implementation
description: Implementation of officiating appointment and confirmation eligibility after probation completion.
semantic_text: Successful probation leads to officiating appointment and permanent confirmation eligibility when vacancies arise.

name: Training Allowance Implementation

semantic_text: Probationary officers receive consolidated training allowances during training, with different rates based on location.

name: Post-Probation Pay Implementation

semantic_text: After probation, pay is refixed in regular scale with credit for increments earned during training/probation.

name: Regular Employee Training Implementation
description: Implementation of training provisions for regular government servants with salary protection.
semantic_text: Regular employees on training continue receiving current salary plus training allowances for outside training.

name: Non-Government Trainee Stipend Implementation
description: Implementation of stipend/scholarship system for non-government individuals in pre-appointment training.
semantic_text: Non-government trainees receive stipends during pre-appointment training at government-determined rates.

name: Increment Accrual Implementation
description: Implementation of increment accrual system with dual annual dates and day-after-earning effectiveness.
semantic_text: Increments are granted on Jan 1 and Jul 1 each year, effective from the day after they are earned.

name: Service Counting Implementation
description: Implementation of service counting rules for increment eligibility across various service scenarios.
semantic_text: Various types of service and leave count toward increment eligibility, with specific rules for each scenario.

name: Increment Withholding Implementation

semantic_text: Increments can be withheld as penalty under disciplinary rules, with orders specifying duration and future impact.

name: Efficiency Bar Implementation

semantic_text: Efficiency bars require competent authority approval to cross, with regular six-monthly reviews.

name: Disciplinary Reduction Implementation

semantic_text: Disciplinary pay reductions include specific orders regulating future increment progression.

name: Special Pay Implementation

name: Special Pay Counting Implementation

semantic_text: Special pay received during authorized periods counts as regular pay for all benefits and calculations.

name: Personal Pay Implementation

name: Charge Allowance Implementation

name: Officiating Appointment Implementation

semantic_text: Officiating appointments to higher posts are for vacancies over one year, with minimum higher scale pay.

name: House Rent Allowance Implementation

semantic_text: HRA is payable to employees not occupying government quarters, with automatic rate increases on promotion.

name: Non-Practising Allowance Implementation

semantic_text: Medical officers receive allowance for restrictions on private medical practice, at government-prescribed rates.

name: Joining Time Implementation
description: Implementation of joining time system for inter-station transfers.
semantic_text: Transferred employees receive 6 days preparation time plus actual travel time as joining time.

name: Joining Time Extension Implementation
description: Implementation of joining time extension for uncontrollable circumstances preventing timely joining.
semantic_text: Competent authorities can extend joining time when employees face uncontrollable circumstances.

name: Joining Time Status Implementation

semantic_text: Joining time is treated as duty period for all service-related purposes and benefits.

name: Joining Time Pay Implementation
description: Implementation of pay during joining time at previous post's rate.
semantic_text: Employees receive pay at their previous post's rate during joining time, not the new post's rate.

name: Disciplinary Procedure Implementation
description: Implementation of prescribed procedures for dismissal, compulsory retirement and suspension.
semantic_text: Disciplinary actions must follow established procedures before implementation.

name: Pay Cessation Implementation
description: Implementation of pay and allowance cessation upon disciplinary order service.
semantic_text: Pay stops from disciplinary order service date, with full day pay for afternoon service.

name: Subsistence Allowance Implementation
description: Implementation of subsistence allowance system for suspended employees.
semantic_text: Suspended employees receive 50% subsistence allowance initially, adjustable after three months based on responsibility.

name: Reinstatement Implementation
description: Implementation of reinstatement procedures with back pay and service credit provisions.
semantic_text: Reinstated employees receive appropriate treatment of absence period based on suspension justification.

name: Retirement Implementation

semantic_text: Regular employees retire at 58 on month-end, with government retaining age modification rights.

name: Compulsory Retirement Implementation
