semantic_text: Government can retire employees aged 50+ or with 25+ years service for public interest with 3 months notice.

name: Service Extension Implementation
description: Implementation of service extension beyond retirement age for government interest cases.
semantic_text: Service extensions require government interest justification and fitness verification, limited to 3 years total.

name: Suspension Retirement Restriction Implementation
description: Implementation of retirement restriction for suspended employees pending enquiry completion.
semantic_text: Suspended employees cannot retire until disciplinary enquiries are completed and final orders issued.

name: Re-employment Implementation
description: Implementation of re-employment system for retired employees with pay plus pension limitations.
semantic_text: Retired employees can be re-employed for government interest, with total compensation limited to last drawn salary.

name: Voluntary Retirement Implementation
description: Implementation of voluntary retirement system after 20 years service with notice requirements.
semantic_text: Employees with 20+ years service can seek voluntary retirement with 3 months notice requiring acceptance.

name: Lien Concept Interpretation
description: Interpretation of lien as representing the right/title of a Government Servant to hold a regular post, either permanent or temporary, either immediately or on termination of periods of absence.
semantic_text: Lien represents substantive rights to regular posts for confirmed employees and those completing probation in higher posts.

name: Lien Reversion Interpretation
reference: Explanation example under Rule 5(11) of SGSR, 1974
description: Interpretation that junior-most person in grade liable to reversion if number of persons entitled to lien exceeds available posts in grade.
semantic_text: When lien holders exceed available posts, junior-most employees face reversion to maintain post-lien balance.

name: Month Calculation Interpretation
description: Interpretation that in calculating periods expressed in months and days, complete calendar months should first be calculated irrespective of days in each month, then odd days calculated subsequently.
semantic_text: Time period calculations prioritize complete months before counting remaining days for accuracy.

name: Personal Pay Interpretation
description: Interpretation of personal pay as additional pay granted to save from loss of substantive pay due to revision or reduction otherwise than disciplinary, or in exceptional circumstances.
semantic_text: Personal pay protects against pay reductions from administrative changes or addresses exceptional circumstances.

name: Special Pay Interpretation
description: Interpretation of special pay as additional pay granted for specific addition to responsibility and for exceptional circumstances.
semantic_text: Special pay compensates for additional responsibilities or addresses exceptional work circumstances.

name: Probation Status Interpretation
description: Interpretation that status of newly appointed person purely temporary till completion of prescribed probation period continuously and satisfactorily.
semantic_text: New appointees have temporary status during probation, becoming eligible for confirmation only after satisfactory completion.

name: Confirmation Delinking Interpretation
description: Interpretation that confirmation delinked from availability of permanent vacancy in grade.
semantic_text: Confirmation eligibility depends on probation completion rather than permanent post availability.

name: Promotion Benefits Interpretation
description: Interpretation that officer promoted on regular basis without prescribed probation has all benefits of confirmed person in that grade.
semantic_text: Regular promotions without probation requirements confer full confirmation benefits immediately.

name: Lien Acquisition Interpretation
description: Interpretation that confirmed government servant acquires lien on post while performing duties or during authorized absence except retirement or suspension.
semantic_text: Confirmation establishes lien rights maintained during duty performance and authorized absences.

name: Transfer Pay Protection Interpretation
description: Interpretation that transfer shall not be to post carrying less scale of pay except on disciplinary action grounds.
semantic_text: Regular transfers maintain pay scale protection, with disciplinary actions as only exception for lower scale transfers.

name: Pay Commencement Interpretation
description: Interpretation that pay and allowances commence from duty assumption date, with afternoon assumption delaying entitlement to next day.
semantic_text: Pay entitlement begins from actual duty assumption, with specific timing considerations for afternoon assumptions.

name: Duty Pay Interpretation
description: Interpretation that duty pay and allowances entitlement only during periods of actual duty performance.
semantic_text: Pay is only for periods when employees actually perform assigned duties of their posts.

name: Resignation Interpretation
description: Interpretation of different resignation requirements for temporary (30 days notice) and permanent (3 months notice with acceptance) employees.
semantic_text: Resignation procedures differ significantly between temporary and permanent government servants.

name: Absence Limitation Interpretation
description: Interpretation that continuous leave cannot exceed three years and absence beyond maximum period results in service cessation.
semantic_text: Three-year maximum absence limit with automatic service termination for exceedance, excluding approved deputation/training.

name: Initial Pay Interpretation
description: Interpretation that initial pay fixed at minimum of scale with higher start possible for qualifications/experience.
semantic_text: New appointments typically start at scale minimum, with higher starting pay requiring justification.

name: Identical Scale Transfer Interpretation
description: Interpretation that transfer to post with identical scale maintains current pay without change.
semantic_text: Same-scale transfers preserve current pay level without refixation or adjustment.

name: Promotion Pay Interpretation
description: Interpretation that promotion pay fixed at stage next above pay notionally arrived at by adding one increment in lowest rate of higher scale.
semantic_text: Promotion pay is calculated by adding one increment to higher scale minimum for fixation.

name: Reversion Pay Interpretation
description: Interpretation that reverted employee's pay fixed at stage he would have drawn had he continued in post.
semantic_text: Reverted employees receive pay based on notional continuation in their original post.

name: Scale Revision Interpretation
description: Interpretation that pay scale revision requires refixation of existing employees' pay according to revision orders.
semantic_text: Pay scale changes trigger refixation of current employees' pay using prescribed revision methodology.

name: Temporary Post Pay Interpretation
description: Interpretation that temporary employee moved after post abolition maintains current pay in new same/higher scale post.
semantic_text: Temporary employees maintain current pay when moved to same or higher scale posts after temporary assignment ends.

name: Kinds of Leave
description: The following kinds of leave may be granted to Government servants: (a) Casual Leave; (b) Special Casual Leave; (c) Earned Leave; (d) Half Pay Leave; (e) Commuted Leave; (f) Extraordinary Leave; (g) Maternity Leave; (h) Paternity Leave; (i) Study Leave; (j) Vacation Department Leave.
semantic_text: Ten distinct types of leave are available to government servants under various circumstances and conditions.

name: Right to Leave
description: Leave cannot be claimed as of right. When the exigencies of public service so require, discretion to refuse or revoke leave of any description is reserved to the authority empowered to grant it.
semantic_text: Leave is not an automatic entitlement and can be refused or revoked based on public service requirements.

name: Effect of Leave on Lien
description: A Government servant on leave continues to retain his lien on the post unless he is removed from service or appointed substantively to another post.
semantic_text: Leave periods do not affect an employee's lien on their substantive post unless they are removed or substantively appointed elsewhere.

name: Competent Authority for Leave Grant
description: Leave of all kinds may be granted by the authority competent to make substantive appointment to the post or by any authority to whom such power may be delegated.
semantic_text: Leave sanctioning authority rests with the appointing authority or their delegated subordinates.

name: Combination of Leave
description: Different kinds of leave may be combined or granted in continuation, subject to the conditions applicable to each kind of leave.
semantic_text: Various types of leave can be combined or taken consecutively following their respective rules.

name: Commencement and Termination of Leave
description: Leave ordinarily begins on the day on which transfer of charge is effected and ends on the day preceding that on which charge is resumed. If the charge is given up or taken over in the afternoon, leave begins or ends, as the case may be, on the following day.
semantic_text: Leave periods are calculated based on charge transfer timing, with afternoon transfers affecting start/end dates.

name: Recall from Leave
description: A Government servant on leave may be recalled to duty when public interest so requires. The period of leave not spent shall be credited to his leave account. He shall be entitled to travelling allowance for the journey to join duty.
semantic_text: Employees can be recalled from leave for public service needs, with unutilized leave credited back and travel expenses covered.

name: Overstayal of Leave
description: A Government servant who remains absent after the end of leave is entitled to no leave salary for the period of such absence and that period shall be debited against his leave account as though it were half pay leave to the extent such leave is due, the balance being debited as extraordinary leave.
semantic_text: Unauthorized leave extension results in no pay and debit against leave account as half-pay and extraordinary leave.

name: Casual Leave
description: Casual leave is granted for short periods to cover casual absence from duty for unforeseen needs. It is not treated as leave and is not debited to the leave account. The maximum casual leave that may be granted to a Government servant in a calendar year is 15 days.
semantic_text: Casual leave allows up to 15 days annual short absence for unforeseen needs without affecting regular leave balance.

name: Special Casual Leave
description: Special casual leave may be granted for specific purposes such as participation in sports, cultural activities, voluntary blood donation, or other special circumstances as may be specified by the Government from time to time.
semantic_text: Special casual leave is available for designated activities like sports, cultural events, and blood donation.

name: Earned Leave
description: A Government servant shall earn leave at the rate of 2 days for each completed calendar month of service. The maximum earned leave that may be granted at a time is 180 days. The maximum earned leave that can be accumulated is 300 days.
semantic_text: Employees earn 2.5 days leave monthly, with 180 days maximum per grant and 300 days total accumulation limit.

name: Half Pay Leave
description: A Government servant shall be entitled to half pay leave at the rate of 20 days for each completed year of service. The half pay leave account shall be credited in advance in two installments of 10 days each on the first day of January and July of every calendar year.
semantic_text: Half pay leave accrues at 20 days annually, credited in advance twice yearly in 10-day installments.

name: Commuted Leave
description: Commuted leave not exceeding half the amount of half pay leave due may be granted on medical certificate to a Government servant subject to the condition that twice the amount of commuted leave shall be debited against the half pay leave account.
semantic_text: Commuted leave allows conversion of half-pay leave to full pay, with double debit against half-pay leave balance.

name: Extraordinary Leave
description: Extraordinary leave may be granted to a Government servant in special circumstances when no other leave is due or when other leave is due but the Government servant applies for extraordinary leave. No salary is payable during extraordinary leave.
semantic_text: Extraordinary leave provides unpaid absence when no other leave is available or specifically requested.

name: Maternity Leave
description: A female Government servant may be granted maternity leave for a period of 180 days. Such leave may be combined with any other kind of leave due and admissible. Maternity leave may be granted for a maximum of two surviving children.
semantic_text: Female employees receive 180 days maternity leave, combinable with other leave, limited to two surviving children.

name: Paternity Leave
description: A male Government servant may be granted paternity leave for a period of 15 days within the period of 6 months from the date of delivery of the child. Paternity leave may be granted for a maximum of two surviving children.
semantic_text: Male employees receive 15 days paternity leave within 6 months of childbirth, limited to two surviving children.

name: Study Leave
description: Study leave may be granted to a Government servant to undergo a specific course of study or training which may improve his professional knowledge or efficiency. The maximum period of study leave that may be granted is 24 months.
semantic_text: Study leave up to 24 months is available for professional development through approved courses or training.

name: Vacation Department Leave
description: A Government servant serving in a vacation department shall not be entitled to earned leave in respect of duty performed in that department, except when the leave is required for a purpose for which vacation cannot be utilized.
semantic_text: Employees in vacation departments have restricted earned leave entitlement, primarily utilizing scheduled vacations.

name: Leave Salary
description: A Government servant on earned leave, commuted leave, maternity leave or study leave shall be entitled to leave salary equal to the pay drawn immediately before proceeding on leave. For half pay leave, the leave salary shall be equal to half of such pay.
semantic_text: Leave salary varies by leave type: full pay for earned, commuted, maternity and study leave; half pay for half-pay leave.

name: Leave Travel Concession
description: A Government servant may be granted leave travel concession to visit his hometown or any place in India once in a block of two years. The concession includes fare for self and family.
semantic_text: Employees receive travel concession every two years to visit hometown or any Indian destination with family.

name: Medical Certificate Requirements
description: Leave on medical certificate may be granted only on production of a certificate from a registered medical practitioner or a medical officer of the Government. The certificate shall specify the nature and probable duration of illness.
semantic_text: Medical leave requires certification from registered practitioners or government medical officers detailing illness nature and duration.

name: LEAVE RULES
description: Comprehensive regulations governing all types of leave available to government servants including casual leave, earned leave, half pay leave, commuted leave, extraordinary leave, maternity leave, paternity leave, study leave, and vacation department leave.
semantic_text: Chapter IX provides detailed framework for various leave types, their accrual, sanctioning procedures, salary during leave, and combination rules.

name: Travelling Allowance Eligibility
description: A Government servant shall be entitled to travelling allowance when he travels on tour or is transferred from one station to another in the interest of public service. The allowance shall cover the cost of travel and incidental expenses.
semantic_text: Government servants receive travelling allowance for official tours and transfers between stations to cover travel and incidental costs.

name: Types of Travelling Allowance
description: Travelling allowance shall be of the following kinds: (a) Daily Allowance; (b) Mileage Allowance; (c) Conveyance Allowance; (d) Transfer Travelling Allowance.
semantic_text: Four main types of travelling allowance cover different travel scenarios including daily expenses, distance-based costs, local conveyance, and transfer expenses.

name: Daily Allowance
description: Daily allowance is granted to meet the charges for lodging and boarding and other incidental expenses. The rates of daily allowance shall be as prescribed by the Government from time to time based on the grade of the Government servant and the class of city.
semantic_text: Daily allowance covers accommodation, food and incidental expenses at prescribed rates based on employee grade and city classification.

name: Mileage Allowance
description: Mileage allowance is granted for the actual distance travelled on tour or transfer. The rates shall be as prescribed for different modes of transport including rail, road, and air travel.
semantic_text: Mileage allowance reimburses actual travel distance costs at prescribed rates for various transportation methods.

name: Conveyance Allowance
description: Conveyance allowance may be granted to a Government servant who is required to perform extensive local journeys in the discharge of his duties. The allowance may be fixed as a monthly amount or as actual expense reimbursement.
semantic_text: Conveyance allowance supports extensive local travel through monthly fixed amounts or actual expense reimbursement.

name: Transfer Travelling Allowance
description: A Government servant transferred from one station to another shall be entitled to transfer travelling allowance which includes: (a) Cost of travel for self and family; (b) Cost of transportation of personal effects; (c) Daily allowance for the period of journey.
semantic_text: Transfer travelling allowance covers employee and family travel costs, personal belongings transportation, and daily expenses during relocation.

name: Travel by Different Modes
description: The mode of travel and entitlement shall be as prescribed for different grades of Government servants. Air travel may be permitted for higher grades and for journeys beyond specified distances. Rail travel entitlement shall be according to class prescribed for the grade.
semantic_text: Travel mode entitlements vary by employee grade, with air travel for senior officers and long distances, and specific rail classes for others.

name: Family Definition for Travel
description: For the purpose of travelling allowance, 'family' includes the Government servant's spouse, legitimate children, step-children, and legally adopted children who are wholly dependent on him and normally reside with him.
semantic_text: Travel allowance family definition includes spouse, dependent children, step-children and adopted children residing with the employee.

name: Tour Diary Requirements
description: A Government servant on tour shall maintain a tour diary recording the places visited, dates of arrival and departure, work done, and meetings attended. The tour diary shall be submitted to the controlling authority within one week of return from tour.
semantic_text: Tour diaries documenting travel details and work activities must be maintained and submitted to supervisors after tours.

name: Advance for Travelling Allowance
description: A Government servant may be granted an advance of travelling allowance to meet the expenses of the journey. The advance shall be adjusted against the final claim for travelling allowance after completion of the journey.
semantic_text: Travel advances can be provided for journey expenses and later adjusted against final travel allowance claims.

name: International Travel
description: International travel shall require prior approval of the Government. The travelling allowance for international travel shall be regulated by special orders issued in each case.
semantic_text: Foreign travel needs government pre-approval and follows special allowance rates determined case by case.

name: Travel by Private Vehicle
description: A Government servant may use his private vehicle for official travel with prior permission. The mileage allowance for private vehicle shall be at the prescribed rate per kilometer.
semantic_text: Private vehicle use for official travel is permitted with prior approval and reimbursed at prescribed kilometer rates.

name: Accommodation during Travel
description: When Government accommodation is provided at the tour station, the Government servant shall not be entitled to lodging charges. If Government accommodation is not available, he may claim actual lodging charges subject to prescribed limits.
semantic_text: Lodging allowance depends on government accommodation availability, with actual costs reimbursed within limits when not provided.

name: Travel on Retirement
description: A Government servant on retirement shall be entitled to travelling allowance for self and family for the journey from the last station of duty to his hometown or to the place where he intends to settle down after retirement.
semantic_text: Retiring employees receive travel allowance for final relocation to hometown or chosen settlement location with family.

name: Travel on Deputation
description: A Government servant on deputation shall be entitled to travelling allowance for the journey from his parent station to the deputation station and back, as per the terms of the deputation order.
semantic_text: Deputation travel costs between parent and deputation stations are covered according to deputation order terms.

name: Travel for Training
description: A Government servant deputed for training shall be entitled to travelling allowance for the journey from his station to the training institution and back, in addition to any training allowance that may be admissible.
semantic_text: Training-related travel expenses to and from training institutions are reimbursed along with applicable training allowances.

name: Revision of Allowance Rates
description: The rates of travelling allowance may be revised by the Government from time to time taking into account the changes in cost of travel and accommodation.
semantic_text: Travel allowance rates are periodically updated by government to reflect changing travel and accommodation costs.

name: Supplementary Provisions
description: The Government may issue supplementary instructions and clarifications for the proper implementation of these rules. Such instructions shall be binding on all Government servants.
semantic_text: Government can issue additional binding instructions and clarifications for effective rule implementation.

name: Repeal and Savings
description: The Sikkim State Service Rules, 1940 and all amendments thereto are hereby repealed. Provided that any order made, action taken, or anything done under the repealed rules shall be deemed to have been made, taken or done under the corresponding provisions of these rules.
semantic_text: Previous 1940 rules are repealed but existing orders and actions under them remain valid under new rules.

name: Power to Remove Difficulties
description: If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of these rules, the Government may, by order, make such provisions or give such directions not inconsistent with the purposes of these rules, as appear to it to be necessary for removing the difficulty.
semantic_text: Government has authority to issue orders resolving implementation difficulties while staying consistent with rule purposes.

name: TRAVELLING ALLOWANCE
description: Comprehensive regulations governing travelling allowances for government servants including daily allowance, mileage allowance, conveyance allowance, transfer travelling allowance, and rules for different travel modes and circumstances.
semantic_text: Chapter X provides detailed framework for various travel allowances covering official tours, transfers, training, deputation, and retirement travel.

name: SUPPLEMENTARY PROVISIONS
description: Contains supplementary provisions including power to issue instructions, repeal and savings clause, and power to remove difficulties in implementation.
semantic_text: Supplementary provisions cover transitional arrangements, implementation clarifications, and government powers to resolve operational difficulties.
